p: The reducing capacity of products is an important indicator of their antioxidant effect because it evaluates the ability of the sample to donate hydrogen atoms and to interfere with the free-radical chain reaction [ 31]. A high absorbance indicates a higher antioxidative activity. In this work, the ability of the RaEO to reduce Fe 3+ to Fe 2+ was conducted. Our results show that the reducing capacity increased with the essential oil concentration in a dose-dependent manner with an EC 50 value of 0.604 ± 0.021 mg/mL (Table 2).
